relationships.notes: Appears in Paul’s greeting lists as a trusted coworker, praised as the beloved physician, and remembered as the sole companion who stayed with Paul near the end.
Named alongside Mark within Paul’s circle of coworkers, indicating overlapping mission networks and shared travel plans.

traits.relationship_to_paul: Listed among Paul’s fellow workers in greeting material, implying hands-on collaboration in the mission.
traits.network_status: Appears within a cluster of coworkers that communities are expected to recognize and honor.
traits.later_tradition_note: Subsequent tradition identifies him as a physician and evangelist, though the undisputed letter only names him as a coworker.

traits.beloved_physician: Called the 'beloved physician,' the only explicit New Testament description of his profession.
traits.greeting_and_presence: Sends greetings from Paul’s company to the Colossian assembly, showing his presence with Paul during imprisonment.
traits.association_with_mark: Named in close proximity to Mark and other coworkers, reinforcing his integration within the same mission cohort.

traits.loyal_companion: Remembered as the only coworker still with Paul late in his ministry, underscoring steadfast loyalty.
traits.usefulness_to_ministry: His presence is valued enough that Timothy is told Luke alone remains, highlighting his utility in supporting Paul.
traits.historical_memory: The reference preserves a later memory of Luke as a long-term associate who endured hardship alongside Paul.
